metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0799 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The HTTP Alternative Services feature in Mozilla Firefox before 37.0.1allows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass an intended X.509certificate-verification step for an SSL server by specifying that serverin the uri-host field of an Alt-Svc HTTP/2 response header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 37.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 37.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 37.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 37.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '37.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
